translated: If the cause and conditions of those have a cause, such as Isvara, etc., it is not suitable that they be incomplete.

original: de'i phyir res 'ga' 'byung bas dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir res 'ga' 'byung bas dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is sometimes active, it is not the case that it is created by Isvara.

original: dus kyis kyang ma byas so //
analyzed: dus kyis kyang ma byas so //
translated: It is not created by time.

original: grangs can gyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin las ma byung ngo //üîΩ'di dag thams cad kyis ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu bsal to //
analyzed: grangs can gyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin las ma byung ngo // 'di dag thams cad kyis ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu bsal to //
translated: It does not arise from the nature imagined by the Samkhyas.üîΩAll of these refute an incompatible cause.

original: tshig thams cad ni rgyu @156b med pa sel te /
analyzed: tshig thams cad ni rgyu @156b med pa sel te /
translated: All of these words refute a causeless origin.

original: rgyu med na ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir res 'ga' 'byung ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir res 'ga' 'byung ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: If there is no cause, it is not tenable that there is occasional arising, because there is no dependence.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po 'dis ni rtag par lta ba la sogs pa bsal to zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa lngar blta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po 'dis ni rtag par lta ba la sogs pa bsal to zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa lngar blta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the five characteristics of dependent origination eliminate the views of permanence and so on, it is said, ‚ÄúIt should be viewed in five ways.‚Äù

original: rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúfive ways‚Äù is the same.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu shin tu tha dad pas rnam pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin ma yin no //üîΩgzhan du na 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu shin tu tha dad pas rnam pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin ma yin no // gzhan du na 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Since cause and effect are completely different, they do not have the same nature.

original: 'di ni rgyu'o zhes bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'o zhes bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to establish the distinction, ‚ÄúThis is the effect,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is the cause.‚Äù

original: 'das pa dang dus mnyam pa'i rgyu las kyang 'bras bu mi 'byung ste da ltar las so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang dus mnyam pa'i rgyu las kyang 'bras bu mi 'byung ste da ltar las so //
translated: An effect does not arise from a cause that is simultaneous with it, but from a present cause.

original: skad cig pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu mi gnas pa dus mnyam pa las mi 'byung ste /üîΩthal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu mi gnas pa dus mnyam pa las mi 'byung ste /üîΩthal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is momentary, when the effect arises, the cause does not endure. It does not arise from a simultaneous cause, because that would be absurd.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun mi 'chad pas chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun mi 'chad pas chad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not annihilated, because the continuum of cause and effect is not interrupted.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi 'dra bas 'pho bar ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi 'dra bas 'pho bar ma yin no //
translated: It is not transferred, because cause and effect are not similar.

original: 'dis ni gang dag gi rgyu'i rang bzhin 'phos nas 'bras bu 'byung bar 'dod pa de dag bstsal to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang dag gi rgyu'i rang bzhin 'phos nas 'bras bu 'byung bar 'dod pa de dag bstsal to //
translated: This refutes those who maintain that the effect arises from the transformation of the essential nature of the cause.

original: shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon la sogs pa chung du las sdong po dang yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa che zhing mang du snang ba'i phyir des sa bon chung du las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub pas skyes bu byed pa don med pa
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon la sogs pa chung du las sdong po dang yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa che zhing mang du snang ba'i phyir des sa bon chung du las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub pas skyes bu byed pa don med pa
translated: Since a large and abundant trunk, branches, leaves, etc. appear from a small seed of a nyagrodha tree, a large effect arises from a small cause. Therefore, the activity of a person is not meaningless.

original: ma yin par dgongs pa'o ;üîΩ/ sa bon ji lta bu btab pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩ'bras s'a lu'i sa bon las 'bras s'a lu'i 'bras bu nyid 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin par dgongs pa'o ; / sa bon ji lta bu btab pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste / 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon las 'bras s'a lu'i 'bras bu nyid 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.üîΩWhatever kind of seed is sown, that kind of fruit arises.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: For example, only a rice grain arises from a rice grain seed, not anything else.

original: 'dis kyang 'bras bu dang / sa bon ma log pas na skyes bu'i byed pa don yod par bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'bras bu dang / sa bon ma log pas na skyes bu'i byed pa don yod par bstan to ;
translated: This also shows that the activity of the person is not meaningless, because the effect and the seed are not reversed.

original: / rgyu gnyis kyis na skyes bu'i byed pa don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / rgyu gnyis kyis na skyes bu'i byed pa don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The activity of the person is not meaningless because of two causes:

original: mnyam pa 'am 'bras bu chung du mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'bras bu log par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa 'am 'bras bu chung du mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'bras bu log par 'grub pa'o //
translated: the effect is accomplished as equal or small, and the effect is accomplished as reversed.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu chen po dang / 'bras bu 'dra bar 'grub pas skyes bu byed pa don ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu chen po dang / 'bras bu 'dra bar 'grub pas skyes bu byed pa don ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the effect is accomplished as great and as similar to the cause, the activity of the person is shown to be meaningful.

original: nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang gnyis kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi rtag pa du ma'i rgyu las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang gnyis kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi rtag pa du ma'i rgyu las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The internal dependent origination is also for two reasons. This shows the characteristic of arising from many impermanent causes.

original: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement beginning with ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic formations,‚Äù shows the characteristic of arising from a powerful condition.

original: de la ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis @157a * //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis @157a * //
translated: Ignorance does not think, ‚ÄúI will produce the karmic formations.‚Äù

original: 'du byed rnams mngon par grub po snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mngon par grub po snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe formations are not thought to be established‚Äù and so on teaches the characteristic of arising from conditions that are devoid of an agent.

original: rkyen rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rkyen rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the conditions.

original: 'dus nas zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus nas zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving come together‚Äù means that the atoms are mutually related.

original: 'thungs pa ni ngoms pa'o //üîΩzos pa ni bza' ba'o //
analyzed: 'thungs pa ni ngoms pa'o // zos pa ni bza' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving drunk‚Äù means having satisfied.üîΩ‚ÄúHaving eaten‚Äù means having consumed.

original: 'chos pa ni bca' ba'o //
analyzed: 'chos pa ni bca' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving chewed‚Äù means having masticated.

original: 'dir yang sa la sogs pa'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang sa la sogs pa'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Here, the characteristic of the activity of earth and so on is taught.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni bsdus pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni bsdus pas kyang ngo //
translated: The consciousness element is also included.

original: 'dir yang nang gi sbu gu dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin ni nam mkha'i khams su dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir yang nang gi sbu gu dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin ni nam mkha'i khams su dgongs so //
translated: Here, the inner hollow, the nature of light and darkness, is considered to be the space element.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par sgrub par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par sgrub par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The consciousness element is that which causes the sprout of name and form to be established.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngar bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mdung khyim ltar gcig tu bsdus la rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngar bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mdung khyim ltar gcig tu bsdus la rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, any consciousness included in the five aggregates of consciousness and the stream of consciousness that is accompanied by the contaminants should be combined into one and called the consciousness element.

original: skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of rebirth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The five aggregates of consciousness are accompanied by the contaminants.

original: 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir de ltar bye brag tu ma byas so //
analyzed: 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir de ltar bye brag tu ma byas so //
translated: Because they are not mistaken, they are not so specified.

original: ci'i phyir sa la sogs pa 'di snyam du bdag cag lus kyi sra ba la sogs pa sngon ma grub par mi sems snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa la sogs pa 'di snyam du bdag cag lus kyi sra ba la sogs pa sngon ma grub par mi sems snyam pa la /
translated: Why do earth, etc., not think, ‚ÄúWe are the hardness, etc., of the body‚Äù?

original: de la sa'i khams ni bdag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams ni bdag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe earth element is not the self, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag la sogs pa thams cad ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa thams cad ni rnam grangs te /
translated: All of the terms ‚Äúself,‚Äù etc., are synonyms.

original: grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pas brtags pa dag go //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pas brtags pa dag go //
translated: They are imputed by the different philosophical schools.

original: nga dang nga'i zhes rlom sems pa ni bdag go //
analyzed: nga dang nga'i zhes rlom sems pa ni bdag go //
translated: The self is the conceit ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de nyid 'gro ba de dang der 'byung bas na sems can no //
analyzed: de nyid 'gro ba de dang der 'byung bas na sems can no //
translated: It is a sentient being because it is the origin of this and that world.

original: tshe'i mtha'i bar du 'tsho bas na srog go //
analyzed: tshe'i mtha'i bar du 'tsho bas na srog go //
translated: It is life because it lives until the end of life.

original: 'byung bas na skye ba po'o //üîΩshed las byung bas na shed las skyes so //
analyzed: 'byung bas na skye ba po'o // shed las byung bas na shed las skyes so //
translated: It is a being because it is born.üîΩIt is a human being because it is born from the womb.

original: shed kyi bu yin pas na shed bu'o //
analyzed: shed kyi bu yin pas na shed bu'o //
translated: It is a human because it is the son of a human.

original: de la sa'i khams ni nga'i nga rgyal dang bral bas na bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams ni nga'i nga rgyal dang bral bas na bdag ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the earth element is not a self because it is devoid of the pride of ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir sems can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir sems can ma yin no //
translated: It is not a sentient being because it is devoid of the activity of going and so on.

original: skad cig pa'i phyir srog ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i phyir srog ma yin no //
translated: It is not life because it is momentary.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i skye ba'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir skye ba po ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i skye ba'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir skye ba po ma yin no //
translated: It is not a being because it is devoid of the activity of being born that is to be generated.

original: las las skyes pa'i phyir shed las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i phyir shed las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a human being because it is born from karma.

original: skyed pa'i shed med pas shed bu ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed pa'i shed med pas shed bu ma yin no //
translated: It is not a human because it is devoid of the womb that generates it.

original: bud med dang @157b skyes pa dang ma ning bdag nyid kyi bdag gzhan med pas bud med ma yin /üîΩskyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: bud med dang @157b skyes pa dang ma ning bdag nyid kyi bdag gzhan med pas bud med ma yin / skyes pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a woman because it is devoid of the nature of a woman, man, or neuter with regard to self and others.üîΩIt is not a man.

original: ma ning ma yin te /
analyzed: ma ning ma yin te /
translated: It is not a neuter.

original: bud med la sogs pa ni sa la sogs pa gnas pa'i bye brag tsam la brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med la sogs pa ni sa la sogs pa gnas pa'i bye brag tsam la brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the woman, etc. are merely distinctions of the elements, earth, etc.

original: nga ma yin bdag ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gis brtags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga ma yin bdag ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gis brtags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not I or mine because it is free from the notions of self and what belongs to the self.

original: gzhan su'i yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa bdag po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan su'i yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa bdag po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not his because there is no creator such as a God.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad la bdag dang bdag gi med pas byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad la bdag dang bdag gi med pas byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since all dharmas are devoid of self and what belongs to the self, how can there be an agent?

original: sngar yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ni bstan na de'i mtshan nyid ma shes pas de'i phyir de la ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: sngar yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ni bstan na de'i mtshan nyid ma shes pas de'i phyir de la ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: The nature of the thing to be fully understood has already been taught. Since its characteristics are not yet known, therefore it is asked: What is ignorance?

original: 'dir yang mtshan nyid rnam pa ldar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan nyid rnam pa ldar gsungs te /
translated: Here, the characteristic is also stated in three ways:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid dang / yan lag gi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid dang / yan lag gi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of intrinsic identity, the characteristic of verbal definition, the characteristic of the connection of its members, the characteristic of freedom from the two extremes, and the characteristic of the inclusion of its causes.

original: gang khams drug po tha dad pa la tha dad pa ma yin par 'du shes pa de ni gcig pur 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang khams drug po tha dad pa la tha dad pa ma yin par 'du shes pa de ni gcig pur 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The notion of unity is the notion that the six elements, though different, are not different.

original: rdul tha dad pa'i lus la gang gcig tu 'dzin pa de ni ril bor 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdul tha dad pa'i lus la gang gcig tu 'dzin pa de ni ril bor 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The notion of totality is the notion that the body, which is a collection of atoms, is one.

original: skad cig so so gzhan du gyur kyang gang dus gzhan na yang 'jug par mi 'dzin pa de ni rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig so so gzhan du gyur kyang gang dus gzhan na yang 'jug par mi 'dzin pa de ni rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The notion of permanence is the notion that, though there is a transformation of each instant, there is no cessation.

original: ma byung ba las 'byung ba la gang yod pa de nyid las skye bar 'dzin pa de ni brten par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba las 'byung ba la gang yod pa de nyid las skye bar 'dzin pa de ni brten par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The notion of dependence is the notion that what exists is produced from that which exists.

original: byung nas med par gyur pa las yang 'das pa'i dus su 'phos pas 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni ther zug tu 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: byung nas med par gyur pa las yang 'das pa'i dus su 'phos pas 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni ther zug tu 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The notion of eternity is the notion that, having come into existence, it passes away, and is grasped as having passed over into the past.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan yang gang gcig tu sdug pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa de ni bde bar 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan yang gang gcig tu sdug pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa de ni bde bar 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The perception of pleasure is the perception of a single nature that is endowed with the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'du shes de dag ni bdag la sogs par 'du shes pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir sngar bstan to //
analyzed: 'du shes de dag ni bdag la sogs par 'du shes pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir sngar bstan to //
translated: Since these perceptions are the cause of the perceptions of self, etc., they are mentioned first.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba des ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad kyang phyin ci log gi rnam pa las byung ba'i phyir ma rig pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba des ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad kyang phyin ci log gi rnam pa las byung ba'i phyir ma rig pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvarious kinds of nescience such as these‚Äù indicates that the entire mass of afflictions, such as the view of self, etc., are also of the nature of nescience because they arise from the aspect of error.

original: de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o zhes de ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o zhes de ston te /
translated: It shows that one part of that is craving, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis bskyed pa'i @158a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis bskyed pa'i @158a * //
translated: Because they are generated by craving, hatred, and delusion,

original: phyir lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las 'di nyid la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ces gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las 'di nyid la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ces gsungs te /
translated: these actions of body, speech, and mind are called craving, hatred, and delusion.

original: btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are so called because they are designated as such.

original: mngon par chags pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni bu dang chud ma la sogs pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni bu dang chud ma la sogs pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: Possessed of attachment means desiring sons, wives, and so on.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag lus dang sems 'khrugs par gyur pa rgyal po'i zha 'bring byed pa dang / tshong byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag lus dang sems 'khrugs par gyur pa rgyal po'i zha 'bring byed pa dang / tshong byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Such as these refers to those whose bodies and minds are disturbed by the performance of royal duties, by business transactions, and so on.

original: lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood and therefore needs no commentary.

original: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: As for because of great darkness, it is ignorance, and so on, this teaches the definition of the terms.

original: de kho na med pa bzhin du byed pas na ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na med pa bzhin du byed pas na ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance because it acts as if reality did not exist.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it accumulates, it is the formative forces, because they accumulate the karma that leads to renewed existence.

original: rnam par rig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes perception, it is consciousness, because it causes the perception of the object.

original: brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang gis 'di la rnam par shes pa gshol ba dang / gzugs su rung bas na go rims bzhin du ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang gis 'di la rnam par shes pa gshol ba dang / gzugs su rung bas na go rims bzhin du ming dang gzugs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the support‚Äù means that consciousness is plowed by the power of existence and is made into form, and thus there is name-and-form in that order.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the sutras,

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: four stations of consciousness are taught.

original: gzugs la nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba la nye bar song ba dang / 'du shes la nye bar song ba dang / 'du byed la nye bar song ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba la nye bar song ba dang / 'du shes la nye bar song ba dang / 'du byed la nye bar song ba ste /
translated: Consciousness is associated with form, feeling, conceptualization, and volitional dispositions.

original: rnam par shes pa ni skad cig kyang mi brten par gnas pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni skad cig kyang mi brten par gnas pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness does not remain without support even for an instant.

original: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye zhing 'phel bar byed pas skye mched de /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye zhing 'phel bar byed pas skye mched de /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the origination‚Äù means that the six sense bases are the origination of consciousness, because they cause consciousness to originate and increase.

original: skye mched drug 'dus pas skye mched drug go //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'dus pas skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense bases are the coming together of the six sense bases.

original: reg pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis yul dang dbang bo dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun 'dus shing reg pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis yul dang dbang bo dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun 'dus shing reg pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of contact means that by its power, the object, faculty, and consciousness mutually combine and contact.

original: myong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dis sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu tshor zhing myong bar byed pas na tshor ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dis sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu tshor zhing myong bar byed pas na tshor ba'o //
translated: Because of experience means that feeling experiences the result of former karma.

original: skom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de yang srid pa la sogs pa 'dod cing skom pas sred pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de yang srid pa la sogs pa 'dod cing skom pas sred pa'o //
translated: Because of thirst means that craving is thirsty and desirous of existence, etc.

original: nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa 'dzin cing len pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa 'dzin cing len pa ste /
translated: Because of grasping means that grasping is the grasping and holding of a new existence.

original: 'dod pa dang lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba la mngon par zhen pa ni len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba la mngon par zhen pa ni len pa'o //
translated: The grasping of desire, the grasping of views, the grasping of morality and asceticism, and the grasping of a doctrine of self are grasping.

original: yang srid pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la skyes pa 'byung bas na @158b srid pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la skyes pa 'byung bas na @158b srid pa'o //
translated: Because of generating a new existence means that existence is the arising of birth in that new existence.

original: lhag ma rnams ni brda phrad par sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni brda phrad par sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The remaining members are not explained because they are easy to understand.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa log par khong du chud pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang po bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa log par khong du chud pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang po bstan to //
translated: The first characteristic of ignorance, etc. is taught because of the misunderstanding of the selflessness of the person.

original: da ni bdag med pa gnyi ga log par khong du chud pa la yan lag gi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bdag med pa gnyi ga log par khong du chud pa la yan lag gi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, the other characteristic of the connection of the members is taught for the sake of the misunderstanding of both kinds of selflessness.

original: gang zag gang dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na mi rtogs pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na mi rtogs pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: That is to say, ignorance is the non-comprehension of reality, the characteristic of the selflessness of the person and of things.

original: de yang shes pa med pa nyid ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang shes pa med pa nyid ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: And it is not just the absence of knowledge.

original: phyin ci log gi tshul gyis shes pas na mi shes pa zhes brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi tshul gyis shes pas na mi shes pa zhes brjod par 'dod de /
translated: It is called non-knowledge because it is knowledge in a distorted way.

original: log par shes pa'o zhes rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: log par shes pa'o zhes rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by synonym as wrong knowledge.

original: des gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la mngon par zhen pa yang log par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na ma rig pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la mngon par zhen pa yang log par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na ma rig pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And because the attachment to things such as form is also of the nature of wrong knowledge, it is called ignorance.

original: skabs gzhan nas kyang mi shes pa'i sgras de nyid brjod do //
analyzed: skabs gzhan nas kyang mi shes pa'i sgras de nyid brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúignorance‚Äù is also used in other contexts.

original: shes pa med pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir don 'di rnam grangs gzhan du ston to //
analyzed: shes pa med pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir don 'di rnam grangs gzhan du ston to //
translated: Since it is not the absence of consciousness, this meaning is taught in another way.

original: yan lag gi mtshams sbyor bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa yod na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yan lag gi mtshams sbyor bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa yod na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the connection between the members, it is said: ‚ÄúWhen there is ignorance, there are the karmic formations.‚Äù

original: byis pa dag bdag la sogs par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas tshe 'di la bde ba'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa'i las mang du byed phyis bde ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi las kyang byed /
analyzed: byis pa dag bdag la sogs par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas tshe 'di la bde ba'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa'i las mang du byed phyis bde ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi las kyang byed /
translated: Fools, through their mistaken attachment to a self, etc., create much non-meritorious karma for the sake of happiness in this life. They also create meritorious karma for the sake of future happiness.

original: sdug bsngal yang med bde ba yang med pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i las kyang byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang med bde ba yang med pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i las kyang byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
translated: They also create immovable karma for the sake of neither suffering nor happiness. This is the condition of ignorance giving rise to the karmic formations.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa ni gti mug las byung bas ni ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba zhes bya bar rigs na bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed dag ni rtag tu ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung bas ma rig
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa ni gti mug las byung bas ni ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba zhes bya bar rigs na bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed dag ni rtag tu ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung bas ma rig
translated: Nonmeritorious action is said to arise from delusion, so it is logical that it arises from the condition of ignorance.üîΩBut since meritorious and invariable action always arise from the roots of virtue such as nonattachment, they do not arise from ignorance.üîΩ

original: pa'i rkyen las byung bar ji ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: pa'i rkyen las byung bar ji ltar rigs she na /
translated: Nonmeritorious action is produced from delusion, so it is reasonable to say that it arises from the condition of ignorance. But how can meritorious and invariable action be said to arise from the condition of ignorance, since they are always produced from the roots of virtue such as nonattachment?

original: de nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault here.

original: ma rig pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Ignorance is of two kinds:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na la rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na la rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of delusion regarding cause and effect and the characteristic of delusion regarding reality.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu la rmongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'du byed rnams ni bsod nams ma yin pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu la rmongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'du byed rnams ni bsod nams ma yin pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Meritorious action is produced from the cause of delusion regarding cause and effect,

original: bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the cause of delusion regarding reality.

original: de dag ni de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'dod de /üîΩbdag bde bar gyur la sdug bsngal bar ma @159a * //
analyzed: de dag ni de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'dod de /üîΩbdag bde bar gyur la sdug bsngal bar ma @159a * //
translated: Invariable action is produced from the cause of delusion regarding reality,üîΩbut not from the cause of delusion regarding cause and effect.

original: gyur cig ces mngon par zhen nas de mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyur cig ces mngon par zhen nas de mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One becomes attached to the idea May it be! and one creates it.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu rmongs pa ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung yang de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung bas de 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu rmongs pa ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung yang de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung bas de 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, although it arises from a cause that is not confused about cause and effect, it arises from the condition of ignorance, which is characterized by confusion about reality. Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod la /
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod la /
translated: There is that which arises from a cause that is confused about reality.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la rmongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba yang yod pas mi 'gal te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la rmongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba yang yod pas mi 'gal te /
translated: There is also that which arises from a cause that is not confused about cause and effect, which is characterized by the arising of wholesome roots. Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: de nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: de bas na de kho na la log par shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de kho na la log par shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a wrong understanding about reality is called ignorance.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las rgyu'i dngos po 'dod pa'i khams su bsod nams kyis 'gro bar nye bar 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las rgyu'i dngos po 'dod pa'i khams su bsod nams kyis 'gro bar nye bar 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The formative factors that lead to merit are those actions that occur in the desire realm and which lead to rebirth in the desire realm through merit.

original: bsod nams dang mi mthun pas na bsod nams ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi mthun pas na bsod nams ma yin pa ste /
translated: Non-meritorious means not in accordance with merit.

original: de la gang ngan song du 'gro ba'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la gang ngan song du 'gro ba'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: Among them, those compositional activities which lead to the lower realms are those which lead to non-merit.

original: mi g-yo ba ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams de dag gi rgyur gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams de dag gi rgyur gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams te /
translated: Unmoving means the compositional activities which are the cause of the form and formless realms.

original: mi g-yo bar nyer bar 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nyer bar 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: Those which lead to the unmoving are those which lead to the unmoving.

original: yang na bsod nams nyid du gyur cing red pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams nyid du gyur cing red pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Or, those compositional activities which are meritorious and lead to happiness are those which lead to merit.

original: bsod nams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with merit.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood in the same way as before.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: What is consciousness conditioned by compositional activity? This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: de brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: That should be explained.

original: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: From the formations that lead to merit, the consciousness that leads to merit arises.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams ma yin pa nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams ma yin pa nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: From the formations that lead to demerit, the consciousness that leads to demerit arises.

original: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'di ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'di ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the formations that lead to the imperturbable, the consciousness that leads to the imperturbable arises. This is called ‚ÄúConditioned by formations, consciousness comes to be.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir bsod nams la sogs pa 'du byed rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'gro ba gsum du rgyu'i dngos por ram /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir bsod nams la sogs pa 'du byed rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'gro ba gsum du rgyu'i dngos por ram /
translated: This is what is meant: because the consciousness that is infused by the three types of formations‚Äîmerit and so on‚Äîis the cause for the three realms of merit and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras @159b bur 'gro ba de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras @159b bur 'gro ba de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the result of karmic maturation, it is taught that consciousness is the condition for karmic formations.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mnyam du ming dang gzugs kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mnyam du ming dang gzugs kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: Name-and-form is said to be conditioned by consciousness because the maturation of name-and-form is actualized simultaneously with the consciousness of karmic maturation.

original: des yongs su gzung bas 'phel bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir de'i stobs kyis 'phel bar 'gyur bas de dang dus mnyam du 'grub pa ni rnam par shes pa'i
analyzed: des yongs su gzung bas 'phel bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir de'i stobs kyis 'phel bar 'gyur bas de dang dus mnyam du 'grub pa ni rnam par shes pa'i
translated: Since it is embraced by that consciousness, it increases. Therefore, because name-and-form arises from the cause of consciousness that is infused by karmic formations such as merit, it increases by the power of those karmic formations. Thus, it is actualized simultaneously with consciousness.

original: rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Name-and-form is the condition for the six sense bases.

original: skye mched drug gi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i dgos pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i dgos pa grub pa'o //
translated: The six sense bases is the accomplishment of the purpose of the activity of seeing, etc. by the eye, etc.

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The six collections of contact is from eye contact to mind contact.

original: de yang gsum 'dus nas skye'o //
analyzed: de yang gsum 'dus nas skye'o //
translated: And that arises from the coming together of three.

original: la la ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan zhig ces zer te /
analyzed: la la ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan zhig ces zer te /
translated: Some say that contact is a separate mental factor that is the cause of the arising of feeling, etc.

original: gsum 'dus pa nyid las de don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa nyid las de don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a separate thing from the coming together of three.

original: ji lta bur zhes bya ba ni ji ltar tshor ba'i rnam pa skye bar nus pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin du nges pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bur zhes bya ba ni ji ltar tshor ba'i rnam pa skye bar nus pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin du nges pa'o //
translated: What kind? It is ascertained as the nature of a cause that is able to generate the aspect of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i bye brag de dag myong ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi mchog rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i bye brag de dag myong ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi mchog rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The distinctions of feeling are: experience, delight, attachment, and remaining attached.

original: bzhi po de dag ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: These four are synonyms.

original: yang na gang bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba'i dus na myong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba'i dus na myong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, when one experiences a pleasant feeling, that is called experience.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba'i dus na de nyid la yid kyis smon pa ni mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba'i dus na de nyid la yid kyis smon pa ni mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: When one wishes for that very thing at the time of experiencing a painful feeling, that is delight.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni ma 'ongs pa na lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni ma 'ongs pa na lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: When one is attached to a feeling that is neither painful nor pleasant in the future, that is attachment.

original: da ltar de dang 'bral bar mi 'dod pa ni lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar de dang 'bral bar mi 'dod pa ni lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa'o //
translated: When one does not wish to be separated from that at present, that is remaining attached.
